intro: Chelonopsis chekiangensis, commonly known as the Chinese horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like seed pods. The plant produces showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
